false.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a statement, story etc that is false is completely untrue
false.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Please decide whether the following statements are true or false.
false.translation[0].definitions[0].note: In everyday English, people usually say not true rather than false, apart from in the fixed expression true or false:
false.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: based on incorrect information or ideas
false.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I don’t want to give you any false hopes.
The statement gives us a false impression that we understand something when we do not.
false assumptions about people of other cultures
a false sense of security (=a feeling of being safe when you are not really safe)
false.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: not real, but intended to seem real and deceive people
false.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The drugs were hidden in a suitcase with a false bottom.
The man had given a false name and address.
false.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: not sincere or honest, and pretending to have feelings that you do not really have
false.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: ‘You played brilliantly.’ ‘Not really, ’ Ian replied with false modesty.
false.translation[0].note_box[0].section: not real, but intended to seem real and deceive people
made to look or seem like something else, especially something worth a lot more money
a forged  official document or bank note has been illegally made to look like a real one
counterfeit money or goods have been illegally made to look exactly like something else
How do you detect counterfeit currency?
made to look real – used especially about guns, bombs etc or about materials
The two men used an imitation firearm to carry out the robbery.
false – used when you think someone is deliberately trying to deceive people
She put on a phoney New York accent.
The doctors were accused of supplying phoney medical certificates.
false and giving a wrong impression about someone or something
The company was trying to get some spurious respectability by using our name.
false.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: not true or real, but intended to look real in order to deceive people
false.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Firms issuing false certificates might be subject to lawsuits.
false.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: something that you think will save money but which will really cost you more
false.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: It’s a false economy to hire unqualified staff.
